text.section: Within 90 days from the date the complete petition is filed, the Sanitary Commission shall decide on the petition.

In deciding on a petition, the Sanitary Commission may designate a shared facility area if the Sanitary Commission finds that:
The proposed shared facility is necessary for the public health, safety, and welfare of the residents of Dorchester County who would be affected by the proposed shared facility; and
It is feasible:
To construct the proposed shared facility; and
To establish the proposed shared facility area.

section.section: If the Sanitary Commission denies the petition, the petitioners, within 30 days after the denial, may appeal to the Dorchester County Commissioners.

The Dorchester County Commissioners:
Shall determine whether the proposed shared facility meets the applicable standards of this section; and
May affirm, modify, or reverse the decision of the Sanitary Commission.

text.section:
When a petition is approved by the Sanitary Commission or the Dorchester County Commissioners, the Sanitary Commission shall:
Adopt a resolution that:
Provides for construction of the shared facility; and
Designates the boundaries of the shared facility area; and
File the resolution among the Dorchester County land records.
